title: Knife River Indian Villages National Historic Site: Fire Management
body: Fire Management       Fire has historically influenced the landscape at Knife River Indian Villages NHS. The existing FMP has been in place since 1997. A new FMP has been drafted to adopt new terminology and documentation guidelines required by a 2002 revision of the NPS’s Fire Management Policy. The plan is a detailed program for use and control of fire within Knife River Indian Villages NHS and provides specific guidance and procedures for accomplishing Park fire management objectives. Human safety, protection of facilities and the use of fire to manage and restore the ecosystem are priorities.      Fire Management Plan Appendix D evironmental assesment
